• Powers decisions in Boxes 2–9 and override checks
• Not a sequential step — lives behind all gating logic
– If user opens a speciﬁc piece/hotspot

• If the user entered via the gallery
access is checked ﬁrst (e.g., gated by email).

• If the user enters via a direct hotspot share,
is bypassed. Access is then evaluated
directly at the hotspot interaction level.
After the appropriate entry check, each content
type (e.g., narration, overlay, About) is evaluated
for access independently. This logic supports:
• Per-type gating (gated vs subscribed vs public)
– Links are live in all instances
- narration and media might be gated
GRANT ACCESS TO NARRATION / OVERLAY MEDIA
These ﬂows are activated after access logic is evaluated.
They handle gating outcomes like Magic Link email veriﬁcation,
supporter subscription prompts, and temporary access previews from

If deep link includes journey_id, highlight, or hotspot_id,
• Narration/media will be granted per override conditions
• Session must be veriﬁed (via Magic Link)
• Hotspot overrides may be generated via user sharing
• Email not sent / user didn’t click / expired
Used to grant temporary access to narration
Everything is free on the ﬁrst phase
Yes (veriﬁed via deep link journey / hotspot)
Blue Phase 1 (MVP): Image access+ email veriﬁcation
Green Phase 2: Subscriber Narration/overlay media access
Blue/Green Used in both Phase 1 and Phase 2
Grey Special Logic (e.g. Magic Piece, Session)
After temp preview, prompt for email to unlock rest. Other hotspots follow normal gating
This ﬂow governs how access is determined at both piece and
hotspot levels, based on how the user enters and what
content types are gated. It includes session state handling,
email veriﬁcation, subscription prompts, and deep-link
(for Diary of Deji Interactive Art Pieces)
Deﬁnes access control logic across gallery, deep link, and journey
paths - for consistent email/subscription gating across frontend behaviour.,
Includes: email veriﬁcation, subscription prompts, deep-link overrides, and
content access tiering for narration, overlays, and About.
